greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the abundant divisors of n.
comment: Sum of divisors d of n with sigma(d) > 2*d.
a(n) = n when n is a primitive abundant number (A091191). - _Alonso del Arte_, Jan 19 2013
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: If A294889(n) > 0, then a(n) = A294889(n)+n, otherwise a(n) = A294930(n)*n.
example: a(12) = 12 because the divisors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12, but of those only 12 is abundant.
a(13) = 0 because the divisors of 13 are 1 and 13, neither of which is abundant.
mathematica: Table[Total@ Select[Divisors@ n, DivisorSigma[1, #] > 2 # &], {n, 96}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 16 2016 *)
results.author: _Timothy L. Tiffin_, Jan 06 2013
